In total, how much money does the recipient have in their account each month?<n>Output: 3600<n><n>Input:  If you buy one-half of a bag per week, how much would you need to buy to cover your expenses at the end of your first month?<n>Output: 10<n><n>Input: What is an "average" family budget?  Answer: In a typical family the following information is considered an average household budget:  Income: $35,000.       Expenses: $37,100.     Total:.50<n>Average Family Budget - Your Household Expenses is an average family budget for a family of 5 living in the following areas, using the following information, which are considered typical, and which are likely to be included in this average household budget.<n>Average Family Budget - What is an average family budget? - An average family budget is, roughly, a budget of what your entire household takes in and what you make and save.    Each family, however, is unique and different so they may vary, for example, family member income may be higher or lower than family member expenses, perhaps the family has additional children and so on.  An average family budget, then, is a reasonable estimate of "what your entire family takes in and what you earn and save" at your current income level.  An average household budget is generally the median amount (between those two values) of everything your household is able to spend, including what is considered typical.  If your income is lower than you currently make you may choose to allocate some of this money to cover your current expenses with savings rather than to spend your remaining amount on a bigger savings account or perhaps spend the money on a larger vacation or other item or activity.  An average family may decide to spend less, however, since they may have some savings or have planned carefully.  Finally, if your income is significantly higher than your current earning level, you may decide to dedicate a portion of your income to spend at your higher earning level or to take some of this income and use it for living expenses with savings.<n>Average Family Budget:  What does an average family budget represent? - An average family, however, is not

Answers are inputs.<n><n>Inputs - Outputs is a useful tool for making games.<n>Inputs - Output is a tool for showing the power of Game Design to generate solutions to problems the user might have.<n>Inputs -outputs is a powerful tool for creating games.<n><n>Inputs is what is used by the game designer, who wants to show how the user plays or uses the game. In Game Design, we are always trying to understand a game by studying it's input (inputs) and output (outputs).<n>Inputs-Outputs is the ultimate tool for thinking about Game Design.<n><n>Inputs: Inputs - Outputs is

Which city?<n>Output: San Jose, CA<n><n>input: If you want to play bridge for an hour, there are two games.  You start with 1 partner and each partner throws out 2 cards from a deck.  If you pick one player to play you must have a partner to play against.  If you choose to play against 2 players, you need 2 partners to play against.  After your 2 partners, you must play against 1 player who's not a partner of either you or one of your partners.  If you choose the best person to play against, that is the person who is playing to win, meaning he plays the best, so no matter how much he loses, he must lose by no more than 8 cards.  In 2 games, you win if you play to win and you lose if you play to lose.  So, if you choose to play against someone and he leads you with less than 5 cards, you lose.<n>Output: 1<n><n>input: Suppose George has a contract that states that he must spend $200 a week on groceries and dining.  What is the amount of money the poor African country of Cameroon will never see?<n>Output: $2,000,000<n><n>Output:Suppose there are 5 houses with two bathrooms.  Each house is $65,000 and costs no more than $11,000 to build.  If a group of people decide to share all of their rent money, and if they don't buy one bedroom, the cost will be $200.  That means that each person in the group is only paying rent for $11,000 a year.  If they all decide to buy a room in a house by themselves, the cost is $1,500 per month plus $1,500 for building the house.  Therefore, the total cost of the new house for the 5 families will be $22,000.  That means the total house cost is $22,000. If they buy a room in the house for their own use, they have no more than $11000 saved.  That's why people cannot afford a two-person room.  Suppose they need to each buy a car, but they also have a friend who owns a car, so they combine the car buying with their rent payment.  Then they only need to buy a

During the experiment, men were assigned randomly to different groups to see how they would act if they were part of the organization. They were also told to expect that they would make mistakes and that the organization would make mistakes in their favor.  During the assignment period, the men were asked to complete surveys in order to receive training.  One month later, men were randomly assigned to the two following groups.  These groups were similar, but one group would be paid $100, and the other group would be paid $500.  The first group was composed of men who were assigned randomly to both the Newcomer's Club and the regular club.  The second group was composed of men assigned randomly to only the Newcomer's club.  Each group had the same basic training program.  When the eight weeks ended, men were randomly assigned or assigned to both the Newcomers Club and the regular club again.  They were also randomly assigned to the group that received twice as much training.  After all of this, each man was asked to rate performance in three different ways. He speeds up to 60 mph.  Then he speeds back down to 55.  He passes another car at 55 mph again.  At 55 mph again, he speeds up to 60, then speeds back down to 50mph.  Finally, he slows down on the final road to 45mph, where he stops and waits.  How long do you estimate that the man will wait?<n>Output: 10 minutes<n><n>Feedback from all of you has been great and it has definitely made my mind think a lot more about what to write for the questions! It really made me take a step back and really think about what I’ve put before me and what others may have said, and how often we’re reading something without the right perspective. That’s a hard thing to do and it really helps to have others to point out those things. Thanks to all!

If I buy the nuts because I am hungry, I am going to pay $12.00 to have nuts and $8.00 for dried fruit.  If I buy them because they are on sale, I would save $1.00 off my total food cost because nuts are generally cheaper than fruit when purchased together.  If I buy nuts when they are on sale (like when they are offered at the store for only 10% of their value) then I am going to save more than $1.00.

Calculate the per product gross margin. Calculate the per item net margin for the whole order. There are two ways to do this. If you are paying with a check, put the balance due in an envelope marked "Dependent" for the accountant.<n>If you are paying with a credit card, put the account number in an envelope marked "Borrower" for the accountant. The name of the loan must be on the envelope.<n>2.<n>If you are using cash, put the account information (in envelopes marked "Cashier" for accountants and "Loaner" for borrowers) in a safe deposit box.<n>3.<n>If you are buying something by check, put the amount due in a box with the check for a safe deposit box. Do not write your name on the box. The check's amount is confidential information.<n>4.<n>If you are receiving a paycheck from the bank, put the pay stub in an envelope marked "Payee".<n>5.<n>If you are shopping at the supermarket, buy a carton of 2-liters of soda, pay in cash and leave in a safe deposit box marked "Dependent".<n>6.<n>If you are on a vacation, leave the check in a safe deposit box for the accountant in a foreign bank.<n>7.<n>If you are sending money, put the check for an overseas account into an envelope marked "Payment Account".<n><n>Output:<n>8.<n>If you are mailing or sending money abroad, put the money in a foreign currency money pack.<n>9.<n>If you are exchanging one foreign currency for another, put the foreign money in a safe deposit box in this bank.<n>10.<n>If you are going to pay money for a foreign event, make sure your bank does not maintain an account for the event. Put the payment in an envelope marked "Foreign Exchange".<n>11.<n>If you are giving money as a present or if someone else is giving it to you, put the money into cash.<n>12.<n>If you are a doctor, leave your insurance card (or statement from his or her last visit) in a safe deposit form in your office.<n>13.<n>If you are transferring

Answer:<n><n>The numbers are:<n><n>    1.   25%     2. 25%    3. 25%<n><n>The problem is that:<n><n>The state pays 75% and the parents pay 25%.<n><n>However,<n><n>The 25% by parents only goes to 25% of the total state cost.<n><n>Solution:<n><n>As a child grows older the parents pay an additional 25% to the school but they pay 50% of the 100% total cost.<n><n>This would be true if the children didn't grow older but if they do that will no longer hold true.<n><n>The school should be an investment not a financial burden.  How many students should the new school provide in order for it to be a successful investment?<n><n>Solution:<n>The cost is given as 100% but you would only get the investment value if you were not raising your children.<n><n>Solution:  The state pays 50% because it is willing and able to pay more than 25% but if this were a true cost the cost would come all the way down to 25%.<n><n>Solution:  When you drink 3 1/2 cans of soda at breakfast the total amount of fluid you drink that day is 782 ounces. When you drink 6 gallons of water the total amount of fluids you drink in a year is 4,902 ounces. Therefore, total in a year is 36,084 ounces. 36.084 = 3,741.<n><n>Solution:When you drink 6 gallons of fluid a day, the daily amount of fluid you drink in total is 96,844 ounces. Your total drinking fluid daily is 441 pounds. 64.084-96.844 = 1,077.<n><n>Solution:There will always be a difference between your daily fluid intake and your fluid quota. Their marriage is in the best possible health except for the fact that the husband is having a rough time with his erection and the wife is having a hard time with her menstruation.  He asks his friend, "Do you think I should take another Viagra?".  When the friend told him that "if it were up to me, I would", the husband replied, "Why?  Are you sure it's not because you have some kind of disease?  After all, it's my longest marriage and we've never had any problems before.  How can it be a problem when I take two or three pills a day?".  The friend replied, "No, no, I am sure it's my fault.  Because we have only been married for 35 years, it must be all my fault".  The husband replied, "If it were just my erection, I would be taking four or five.  I know it's the hormones!"  The wife said, "I can tell by the blood rushing through my body that you are right.  I am bleeding quite a bit more than normal.  However, the bleeding only occurred when I was trying to perform oral sex.  I don't know how we got to that place."  The wife asked her husband, "Do you want me to go to the doctor and get checked out?"  The husband said, "If that's all you want to do, then I have no problem with you going."  The wife went to a nearby hospital.  The nurse checked out the husband and said, "You have AIDS.  Congratulations, you have AIDS!"

If you were to stand on the<n>bow, you would see the water, and the boat, at about the same location.  If you were standing<n>on the stern, you would see the boat, the water, and the mast, each at a slightly different<n>distance. If the boat was travelling about 10 mph (16 kph) a gallon of<n>gas would be used.  If it were travelling at 1 mph we would only need a gallon of gasoline a<n>mile (2.5 km) so the fuel consumption would be 1 gallon per mile (4.3 kph).  There is no<n>refill option however in a gasoline powered boat so we need to supply the fuel from<n>an alternative source.  In the event that fuel was not available we could pump the water<n>out of the boat.<n>Output: 15 gallons per mile (24 kph) to 14

If it is a good price, John will sell it for $6.00, even though he may not make $6.00.  But suppose John makes $6.00 selling the product at $7.00.   If he sells it at $7.00, John will say to himself, "OK, I'll make $2.00 out of it."  But suppose John sells the product for $8.00.  This means, "OK, I made $3.00 out of it.  If John sells the product for less than $5.00, he will say to himself again, "I made $3.00 worth of product.  My price was $8.00." Why will people pay more, and how much more? How many of the balls will hit the baskets before any player has a chance of hitting one?<n>Output: 8.7<n><n>Input:In an empty room, three people can be alone. If one person can have conversations with everyone else in the room, does she not lose the game of conversation alone?<n>Output: 9<n><n>Input:Two people can be alone in a room.  There is one door in that room.  If one person is not allowed to leave the room, there will be no communication between the two people.  What is the probability the doors will be closed and no communication will be allowed between the two people?<n>Output: 13/9<n><n>Input:Two men ride the bus. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. How many families share the house?<n>Output: 10<n><n>Input: There is a train coming down the track and it will hit one train car full with passengers and another train car full with cargo. What should the train conductor do?<n>Output: He should take the empty train car with cargo and leave the other car empty.<n><n>Input: Three women were in an elevator.  One had a drink on the way up and when the doors opened, she had another drink and took a sip of her drink while she was standing in the elevator with her arms wrapped around her middle. Which option is cheaper?<n>Output: $1 each<n><n>Input: A cow that was born that day weighs one hundred pounds and had a calf that weighed two hundred pounds. The first question in this section covers what the answer is in the first example.  The second example uses the first example as an excuse to write about coffee for 8 long paragraphs!<n><n>Assignment #3<n><n>Your Assignment #3 is to produce your best piece of writing about a single subject.  Choose a topic that will interest you and choose one of the topics in the assignment.  Write an essay of around 500 to 800 words.<n><n>Assignment #4<n><n>You've done a lot of hard work.  Now it's time to receive some recognition for it.<n><n>Use the following prompt from the assignment to complete your Assignment #4:<n><n>"The world is a better place because of people like you."  Choose your favorite person and write an essay on them.<n><n>Your Assignment #5<n><n>Each week you have an assignment called "Assignment #05."  Your assignment requires you to write a short article.  Every Monday you have to write about 3 sentences.  Try to write your essay every day.<n><n>Your Assignment#6<n><n>Week after week you'll have assignments that keep getting longer and longer.  Your assignment, "Assignment #07," requires you to write an article of around 750 words on the subject of what we call "the Internet's impact on children."  This assignment is almost 2 pages long!  The requirements are more than enough to make your head spin, especially if you didn't keep up with the others.  Every Friday, you have another "Assignment #08" but this time the assignment is about what we call "the world's most powerful force for good: the power of the Internet!"  The article you wrote in the previous weeks gets combined and expanded upon.  Make sure you follow every rule in the assignment!<n><n>Your Assignment #9<n><n>The writing assignments keep going and going.  The "Academy Award" assignment required you to write a 700-word essay on "what people want from the music they listen to."  Then, two weeks later, you got a "National Book Award" essay.  Both of these are 7-page essays.  The good ones are only two pages, and usually you get one, sometimes both.
